publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6820Kenneth Gibson:Two Million thanks for Crosshouse Hospital Volunteers—That the Parliament congratulates Crosshouse Hospital Volunteers who have presented NHS Ayrshire and Arran with a cheque for an impressive £275,000; notes that the total amount raised by the volunteers is now £2,080,367; recognises that since 2001, Crosshouse Hospital Volunteers have worked in the hospital running the shop, café and ward trolley service, and that, in 2006, they opened a small café and shop in the Ayrshire Maternity Unit; acknowledges that, in 2003, the volunteers contributed to the purchase of a MRI scanner for the hospital and have also been responsible for purchasing a vast array of equipment for the hospital such as intensive care beds, 107 electric beds and a harmonic scalpel for the gynaecology department and paid for the refurbishment of both the hospital shop and cafeteria in 2005; appreciates that this year’s impressive donation will help buy more equipment, including hospital scanners, a Sonosite ultrasound machine for people with respiratory problems, a bladder scanner for the oncology department, cardiac monitors for Ward 2B, intensive care unit beds and a task force monitor for the clinical physiology department, and thanks the volunteers for their commitment and hard work in raising such a large sum of money in these difficult economic times. Supported by: Cathy Jamieson*, Bob Doris*, Bill Kidd*, Sandra White*, Aileen Campbell*, Gil Paterson*, Stuart McMillan*, Hugh Henry*
